page.title: 08Raised and Low Marsh Ecology
page.content: The highest levels of the{Salt Marsh } may only be {flooded}once or twice a year and therefore the{alluvial mud} does not contain much salt. Plants and animals{adapt to the flooding}by having{succulent leaves}and a{thick {waxy cuticle}to cope with the problem of salty water. Many have{deep tap {roots}to reach fresh water or they grow along the ground because of the{ {unstable mud.}The plants of the raised marsh include; Sea Couch Grass, Arrowgrass, Lavender, Aster, Sea Wormwood, on the softer muds Velvet Mossweed and Cord Grass. The{sea {channels}that cross the marsh have Sea Purslane. The large number of ships using the river and nearby industry add a lot of unwanted material to the marsh, much of the marsh has been lost by draining the land.
